description: Teotihuacan was one of the largest cities in the world during the first millennium CE. Masks like this were displayed in residential compounds and temples, where they were the focus of rituals commemorating ancestors. Although this mask shares features common to others from the city—a broad forehead, prominent nose, receding chin, and widely spaced cheekbones—it is subtly unique, indicating that it may be a stylized portrait.
title: Shell Mosaic Ritual Mask
